summary: This document is a chain of emails from July 2019 between defense attorney Joseph E. Nascimento and an Assistant U.S. Attorney from the Southern District of New York. The emails discuss scheduling a call regarding a grand jury subpoena served on a former partner's client, identified as 'Epstein', and Nascimento's role as the inventory attorney for the deceased partner's law practice.

persons.name: Joseph E. Nascimento
persons.context: Attorney emailing an Assistant U.S. Attorney to schedule a call regarding a grand jury subpoena served on his deceased partner's client, Jeffrey Epstein. He identifies himself as the Florida Bar-appointed inventory attorney for his former partner's practice.

persons.name: Alan Ross
persons.context: Deceased former law partner of Joseph Nascimento who previously represented Jeffrey Epstein. He passed away in 2018.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Implicitly the subject of the grand jury subpoena and the discussion. Referred to as the client of the deceased attorney Alan Ross.

connections.description: Former law partners. Nascimento is now the Florida Bar-appointed inventory attorney for Ross's practice following Ross's death.
Ross represented Epstein prior to his death in 2018, as stated by Nascimento.
Nascimento, as inventory attorney for his deceased partner's practice, is now involved in matters concerning the former client, Epstein, specifically regarding a grand jury subpoena.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Served
events.description: A grand jury subpoena was served earlier in the day on a client (implied to be Jeffrey Epstein) who was formerly represented by the now-deceased attorney Alan Ross.

events.title: Scheduled Attorney Call
events.description: Joseph Nascimento and an Assistant U.S. Attorney schedule a call for 6:30 PM to discuss the grand jury subpoena matter related to Epstein.

locations: 2250 S.W. 3rd Avenue, Miami, Florida 33129 (Law office of Ross Amsel Raben Nascimento, PLLC)
Southern District of New York (jurisdiction of the Assistant U.S. Attorney)
keyFacts: A grand jury subpoena related to Jeffrey Epstein was served on or about July 6, 2019.
Joseph E. Nascimento, a defense attorney, was acting as the Florida Bar-appointed inventory attorney for the law practice of his deceased former partner, Alan Ross, who had represented Epstein.
Nascimento contacted the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to schedule a call regarding the subpoena, indicating federal investigation activity in July 2019.
The email chain shows coordination between defense counsel and federal prosecutors shortly after the subpoena was served.
